Virtual Events
It was March 18, 2020 when Books & Books first locked down and closed our doors temporarily during the quarantine of the COVID-19 pandemic. Almost immediately, independent bookstores everywhere were turning to new technologies to quickly learn how to bring authors online on various livestreaming platforms. In late April, Books & Books launched a virtual author series of ongoing conversations in the midst of a brand-new virtual landscape. Fast forward to 2022 and more than 700 virtual events under our belt, now archived for your viewing pleasure. Scroll through some of these recordings and you’ll find more than 2 years’ worth of fascinating conversations in support of many of the important books published during a truly historic and unprecedented time.
Follow us on Crowdcast
and be the first to know of new events and pairings. You can stay up to date by
subscribing to our newsletter
, too. We are so grateful for your support and patronage, thank you!

The Café at Books & Books
265 Aragon Ave Coral Gables, FL 33134 | 305-448-9599
HOURS: Monday – Friday: 10am – 11pm | Saturday: 9am – 11pm | Sunday: 9am – 10pm
SEE OUR MENU HERE & ORDER TAKE OUT
Discover the charm of The Café at Books & Books in Coral Gables—a cozy haven for book lovers and food enthusiasts alike. Located in the heart of historic Coral Gables, our café offers a relaxed atmosphere surrounded by books and beautiful art. Enjoy a delightful menu featuring fresh salads, sandwiches, vegetarian dishes, homemade pastries, and desserts.
With
special events
and
live music
, it’s a favorite spot for locals and tourists seeking a quiet read, a friendly gathering, or a delicious meal.
Whether you’re here to unwind solo or connect with friends, The Café at Books & Books is your perfect destination.
Dine with us al-fresco in our open air courtyard
or inside our cozy café any day of the week!
JONAH KAPLAN
, a native of Miami, is the General Manager of the family business founded by his father,
Mitchell Kaplan
. With a deep-rooted love for hospitality, Jonah has found his passion in the realms of food, coffee, and wine.
Having grown up in the book business, Jonah has witnessed firsthand the transformative power of literature and the importance of independent bookstores within communities. Inspired by this experience, he is dedicated to preserving and promoting the vitality of the book industry.
With his dedication to the family business and his passion for hospitality, Jonah Kaplan continues to uphold the legacy of his father while forging his own path in promoting the enduring significance of books and the joy of shared experiences at Books & Books. Contact Jonah any time at
[email protected]
Want to cater your event with us?
BROWSE OUR CATERING MENU HERE

T-Shirt, Totes & Support!
Dear Friends & Readers,
Thank you to everyone who supported us during our fundraising campaign!
We’ve had lots of requests to keep the campaign going just a little bit longer for those who didn’t have a chance to place their order.
Each of these one-of-a-kind items is priced at $30 and your purchase benefits Books & Books.
Your support means the world to us!
These T-Shirts are designed featuring our iconic logo and signature Jorge Luis Borges quote:
“I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.”
We’re bringing back a vintage design of the
Books & Books Smiley Face T-Shirt
, designed by our friend Charlie Calderin of Doink Design for our 20th Anniversary in 2002. This is available in new colors and styles for the entire family.
One more special offering is the lovely and sturdy
Books & Books Tote
. This mid-size tote is made of 100% cotton canvas and has side gussets. Perfect for toting around all of your favorite books!
Thanks for supporting us, your locally-owned, independently-run bookstore!
Click here to view the shop!
Shop our “Stand with the Banned” Merch Here

Event content
Books & Books and Temple Beth Sholom present…
A Virtual Event with Jennifer Weiner
In conversation with Katie Kempner
That Summer
(Atria, $28)
Saturday, May 15 12pm ET
PURCHASE BOOK + TICKET HERE
From the #1 New York Times bestselling author of Big Summer comes another timely and deliciously twisty novel of intrigue, secrets, and the transformative power of female friendship.
Daisy Shoemaker can’t sleep. With a thriving cooking business, full schedule of volunteer work, and a beautiful home in the Philadelphia suburbs, she should be content. But her teenage daughter can be a handful, her husband can be distant, her work can feel trivial, and she has lots of acquaintances, but no real friends. Still, Daisy knows she’s got it good. So why is she up all night?
While Daisy tries to identify the root of her dissatisfaction, she’s also receiving misdirected emails meant for a woman named Diana Starling, whose email address is just one punctuation mark away from her own. While Daisy’s driving carpools, Diana is chairing meetings. While Daisy’s making dinner, Diana’s making plans to reorganize corporations. Diana’s glamorous, sophisticated, single-lady life is miles away from Daisy’s simpler existence. When an apology leads to an invitation, the two women meet and become friends. But, as they get closer, we learn that their connection was not completely accidental. Who IS this other woman, and what does she want with Daisy?
From the manicured Main Line of Philadelphia to the wild landscape of the Outer Cape, written with Jennifer Weiner’s signature wit and sharp observations, That Summer is a story about surviving our pasts, confronting our futures, and the sustaining bonds of friendship.
About the Author:
JENNIFER WEINER is the #1 New York Times bestselling author of eighteen books, including Good in Bed, That Summer, and an essay collection, Hungry Heart: Adventures in Life, Love, and Writing. A graduate of Princeton University and contributor to the New York Times Opinion section, Jennifer lives with her family in Philadelphia. Visit her online at JenniferWeiner.com.
About the Moderator:
KATIE KEMPNER is the creator and host of “Perspectives with Katie Kempner”, a long running series of conversations with remarkable working women balancing busy lives. Perspectives can be found as a podcast on Spotify, Apple Podcasts and Google Play and as a limited video series on Amazon Prime.
Katie is also the founder of Kempner Communications, a high-end business communications consultancy based in Miami, Los Angeles and NYC. She is the very proud mother of a son and daughter and lives in Miami Beach with her husband and two dogs.
